title: Class 4: Readings
text: 'Report on open banking and application programming interfaces'
'Fintechs next decade will look radically different' Nik Milanovic
'RPA in Banking Use-cases, Benefits and Steps' Maruti Techlabs

title: Class 4: Study Questions
text: What are some major trends affecting marketing channels & customer processes for financial services?
How are Open API initiatives influencing these trends?
What is robotic process automation (RPA) and screen scraping? How is it being used in the financial sector and does it relate to open API technologies?

title: The three basic types of APIs
text: APIs take three basic forms: local, web-like and program-like. Here’s a look at each type.
The original API, created to provide operating system or middleware services to application programs.
Designed to represent widely used resources like HTML pages and are accessed using a simple HTTP protocol. Often called REST APIs or RESTful APIs.
Based on RPC technology that makes a remote program component appear to be local to the rest of the software.
Source: 'How to do API testing to improve application quality', TechTarget (12/19/19)

title: Open API?
text: Source: 'What is API-led Connectivity', MuleSoft Blog (7/12/17)

title: Finance Customer Interface
text: Credit Cards (1940 – 50s) & Point of Sale Systems (1980s)
Electronic Payments (1870s), Wires (1910s), ACH (1970s) & Direct Deposits (1970s)
Banking - Tents, Temples, Bricks & Mortar (4th – 1st millennium BCE)

title: Open API & Open Banking
text: Open Application Program Interfaces (Open API) allow outside Developers access to and an ability to Integrate Permissioned Customer Data into Third Party Applications
Open Banking initiatives facilitates or mandates Open API for Non-banks to Share Permissioned Bank Customer Data

title: Open API & Open Banking
text: Open Application Program Interfaces (Open API) allow outside Developers access to and an ability to Integrate Permissioned Customer Data into Third Party Applications
Open Banking initiatives facilitates or mandates Open API for Non-banks to Share Permissioned Bank Customer Data

title: Global view of open banking developments
text: In process of adopting or actively considering4
No explicit rule/guidance requiring data sharing.
In process of adopting or actively considering adopting.
Source: 'Report on open banking and application programming interfaces', Bank of International Settlement (November 2019)

title: Third Party Banking APIs - Data Aggregators
Third Party Banking APIs - Account Aggregators
text: CreditSense (Australia and New Zealand), DirectID (UK), Eurobits (Spain),
eWise (Australia, Asia & Europe), figo.io (Germany and Austria),
FinApi (Germany, Austria, Czech Republic and Slovenia), Finicity (US),
FintecSystems (Germany and Austria), FormFree (US), Fractal (UK SMEs),
Brazil & Mexico), Moneyhub (UK), Moneytree (Japan and Australia),
Nordic API Gateway (Scandinavia), Plaid (US), Proviso (Australia and New
Yodlee (US, UK, Spain, Australia, India and New Zealand)
Source: 'List of all banking APIs', Nordigen Medium Post (3/2/17)

title: Plaid

title: Assignments
text: Recommended business and technology strategy within a particular sector
To CEO of B of A, Amazon, or Andreessen Horowitz
Teams required to be Formed and Sector Selected by 4/8
Each student individually addresses 1 of the following:
a) overall market analysis, b) technology trend analysis, c) traditional competitor analysis, & d) big tech & fintech disrupter competitive analysis
